Sentence.sentence: The retail giant said the poor financial performance this year has pushed it to begin implementing $400 million in cost-cutting measures.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It's also pushing ahead in 2016 with an expansion of Bluemercury, the beauty chain it bought last year.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Historically, scientists have objected to sharing for many reasons: it is a lot of work; until recently, good databases did not exist; grant funders were not pushing for sharing; it has been difficult to agree on standards for formatting data; and there is no agreed way to assign credit for data.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Most agree that the solution is to push doctors to accept fixed payments to care for a particular illness or for a patient's needs over a year.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactive television advertising, which allows viewers to use their remote controls to click on advertisements, has been pushed for years.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Pushing the current world leaders to come to a consensus.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Evidence from Australia suggests plain packaging pushes society further along that road.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Companies are pushing it hard  but make it almost overwhelming even to dip a toe in the water for the average consumer, because there are  so many compatibility issues to think about.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That pushed flu from the third leading cause of death to the fifth.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: If you try to push a boulder ( ' ,  大圆石 ), it pushes you bock.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The recent trend toward early decision and early action among selective colleges and universities has pushed the traditional deadline of January up to Nov.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This nameless person pushed the human race over a historic threshold, for it was in that year that mankind became, for the first time in its history, a predominantly urban species.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And yet, the same motivation that can push people to exert more effort in a constructive way could also motivate people to be more likely to engage in unethical behaviors," says Maurice Schweitzer, an associate professor at Penn's Wharton School.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The school aggressively pushed mentoring (辅导) of minorities by other students and "partnering" with parents at a special pre-enrollment session.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Academic studies have found no evidence so far that older voters have used their power at the ballot box to push for policies that specifically benefit them, though if in future there are many more of them they might start doing so.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That's because the quest for a unified theory that would account for all the forces of nature has pushed current mathematics to its limits.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Einstein pushed mathematics almost to its limits
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But less than a month before hand, inspectors found significant problems with the fire safety system and push the opening back again to 2013.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: If you try to push a boulder, it pushes you back.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: They worry that the adolescent peer group has the power to push its members into behavior that is foolish and even dangerous.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: What has become obvious to me when it comes to the income gap is that there needs to be an opportunity for the people at the bottom to push them back up and push them into the middle class to give them hope in their lives.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

means: People United to Save Humanity 人们团结去挽救人类
People United to Serve Humanity 人们团结服务人类

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"促进，推进"之意。
means: further ： 中性词，既可指对好事的促进、推进，又可指对坏事的助长。
advance ： 通常指为加速某一进程或达到某个预期目的而给予有效的促进，强调作出有意识、决定性的努力。
promote ： 指在某一进程的任何时期或阶段提供积极的帮助与支持。
contribute ： 指能促进事物向前发展的因素，但这种因素并非决定性的。
push ： 口语用词，通常指利用自己的活动或影响推进某事。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"推，推动"之意。
means: propel ： 侧重指靠外力把人或物稳定、持续地向前推进。
push ： 普通用词，指用突然的力量把人或物
推向前进、推开或推到另一位置上。
shove ： 一般指猛或费力地推开或移动人或物。
thrust ： 常指迅猛地一推或突然有力地推进，侧重速度。

example.en: h is better to push up the daisies than to suffer.
He pushed up daisies about a year ago.
example.zh: 他大约在一年前撒手人寰了。

list.explanation: 在情况、情势再紧迫一些时或局势、情况更紧张时

example.en: When push comes to shove，you know I'll be on your side.
example.zh: 等到局势愈发地紧迫，你知道，我会站在你一边的。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必须做的,强制性的,[课程]必修的
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+puls驱动,推+ory……的→共同推的→强制性的
impulse[v.冲动]+ive……的→adj.易冲动的,感情用事的
repulse[n.&v.驱逐,击退,厌恶]+ive……的→adj.令人厌恶的,驱逐的
com共同+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→共同推→强制
ex出+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→推出去→驱逐
pro向前+puls驱动,推+ion表名词→向前推
re回+puls驱动,推+e→推回去→击退,驱逐
pulse[n.脉搏,脉冲]+ate表动词→v.有规律的振动,[脉]搏动

word_mean: push-on contact 借助于轴向力达到连接而靠摩擦力限制分离的接触件。
push-pull connector 具有推拉锁紧结构的连接器。
push-button switch 利用按钮推动传动机构，使动触点与静触点按通或断开并实现电路换接的开关。
描述因特网内容提供者和因特网用户之间工作方式的术语。“推送”指因特网内容提供者定期向预订用户“提供”数据。

Sentence.sentence: Each time the bowl of rice is pushed over the table edge, it falls in the ground---and, in the process, it belongs out important evidence about how physical objects interact: bowls of rice do not flood in mid-air, but require support to remain stable.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I pushed her toward the front door, waving at the family, saying, sorry, please forgive us, you have a really nice place.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Ideally, the system would tell us when to adapt human activities that are pushing an ecosystem toward a breakdown.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Instead of seeing my boys as losers, I pushed and encouraged them.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: It was a woman, pushing an old shopping trolley which was piled with bags.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Miss Longfield added: "Then there is this push to connect—if you go offline, will you miss something, will you miss out, will you show that you don't care about those people you are following, all of those come together in a huge way at once."
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Once that happened, I just kept pushing my studying further and further back in my day.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Papa, at the head of the table, would push back his chair and pour a glass of red wine, ready to listen.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Set your alarm clock an hour early and push yourself to work out! You will feel energized all day long.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: She pushed her way to the driver and took the suitcase thankfully, everyone on the bus began talking about what the boy had done, and the crowd of strangers suddenly became friendly to one another.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Television gave another push to the local economy.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: These pictures show people seemingly pushed into a world that they were unprepared for.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This is the most ambitious goal for temperature rise set by the Paris agreement, after a push by low-lying island nations like Kiribati, which say limiting temperature rise to ?
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: We urge congress to increase farmland conservation, as we push for immigration reform.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: When the competitive environment pushed our ancestors to achieve that potential, they could in turn afford more education.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But the headlong push into bachelor's degrees for all—and the subtle devaluing of anything less—misses an important point: That's not the only thing the American economy needs.
Sentence.come: 2018年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: It seems clear that such a scheme is an initiative push toward what would eventually be a compulsory Internet "driver's license" mentality.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: While the conversation around our environment and our responsibility toward it remains centered on shopping hags and straws, we're ignoring the balance of power that implies that as "consumers" we must shop sustainably, rather than as "citizens" hole our
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: You're only human, and sometimes your kids can push you just a little too far.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

sentences.en: If you push the car, I'll steer it.
sentences.cn: 如果你来推车, 我就来驾车。

sentences.en: She pushed the door open.
sentences.cn: 她把门推开。

sentences.en: She pushed the drawer closed.
sentences.cn: 她把抽屉推上了。

lj.lj_ly: The path was barely visible, but we pushed on.

entry.def: When you push something, you use force to make it move away from you or away from its previous position.

example.ex: The woman pushed back her chair and stood up...
example.tran: 那女人把椅子往后一推站了起来。

example.ex: They pushed him into the car.

entry.def: If you push through things that are blocking your way or push your way through them, you use force in order to move past them.

example.ex: I pushed through the crowds and on to the escalator...
example.tran: 我挤出人群，踏上了自动扶梯。

example.ex: Dix pushed forward carrying a glass...
example.tran: 迪克斯拿着杯子往前挤。

entry.def: If an army pushes into a country or area that it is attacking or invading, it moves further into it.

example.ex: One detachment pushed into the eastern suburbs towards the airfield...
example.tran: 一支小分队开进了东部郊区向飞机场挺进。

example.ex: The army may push southwards into the Kurdish areas.
example.tran: 军队可能南下向库尔德地区挺进。

entry.def: To push a value or amount up or down means to cause it to increase or decrease.

example.ex: Any shortage could push up grain prices...
example.tran: 任何一种短缺都会抬高粮食价格。

example.ex: The government had done everything it could to push down inflation...
example.tran: 政府已经采取了所有可能的措施来抑制通货膨胀。

entry.def: If someone or something pushes an idea or project in a particular direction, they cause it to develop or progress in a particular way.

example.ex: We are continuing to push the business forward...
example.tran: 我们正在继续推进业务的发展。

example.ex: The government seemed intent on pushing local and central government in opposite directions.
example.tran: 政府似乎一心想让地方政府和中央政府背道而驰。

entry.def: If you push someone to do something or push them into doing it, you encourage or force them to do it.

example.ex: She thanks her parents for keeping her in school and pushing her to study...
example.tran: 她感谢父母送她上学并督促她学习。

example.ex: James did not push her into stealing the money...
example.tran: 詹姆斯没有怂恿她去偷钱。

entry.def: If you push for something, you try very hard to achieve it or to persuade someone to do it.

example.ex: Britain's health experts are pushing for a ban on all cigarette advertising...
example.tran: 英国的健康专家正努力争取取缔任何形式的香烟广告。

example.ex: Germany is pushing for direct flights to be established.
example.tran: 德国正在努力争取直飞航班的开通。

entry.def: If someone pushes an idea, a point, or a product, they try in a forceful way to convince people to accept it or buy it.
entry.tran: 力劝接受；极力宣传；推销

example.ex: Ministers will push the case for opening the plant...
example.tran: 部长们将极力劝说人们接受开办工厂一事。

example.ex: She knew enough about publishing to know that they could push a hundred thousand copies into the bookshops.
example.tran: 关于出版业她非常了解，很清楚他们能够向书店推销10万本书。

entry.def: When someone pushes drugs, they sell them illegally.

example.ex: She was sent for trial yesterday accused of pushing drugs.
example.tran: 她因被控贩毒昨天被送交法院接受审判。

entry.def: If you say that someone is pushing it, you mean that their actions or claims are rather excessive or risky.

example.ex: I think that he was pushing it a bit when he said it was the best stadium in the world.
example.tran: 他说这是世界上最好的体育场，我觉得说得有些过头。

entry.def: If you get the push or are given the push, you are told that you are not wanted any more, either in your job or by someone you are having a relationship with.

example.ex: Two cabinet ministers also got the push.
example.tran: 两位内阁大臣也被撤职了。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of applying force in order to move something away;

sentences.sentence: "he gave the door a hard push"
"the pushing is good exercise"

means.word_mean: 2. the force used in pushing;

sentences.sentence: "the push of the water on the walls of the tank"
"the thrust of the jet engines"

means.word_mean: 3. enterprising or ambitious drive;

sentences.sentence: "Europeans often laugh at American energy"

means.word_mean: 4. an electrical switch operated by pressing a button;

sentences.sentence: "the elevator was operated by push buttons"
"the push beside the bed operated a buzzer at the desk"

means.word_mean: 5. an effort to advance;

sentences.sentence: "the army made a push toward the sea"

means.word_mean: 1. move with force, "He pushed the table into a corner"
2. press, drive, or impel (someone) to action or completion of an action;

sentences.sentence: "He pushed her to finish her doctorate"

means.word_mean: 3. make publicity for; try to sell (a product);

sentences.sentence: "The salesman is aggressively pushing the new computer model"
"The company is heavily advertizing their new laptops"

means.word_mean: 4. strive and make an effort to reach a goal;

sentences.sentence: "She tugged for years to make a decent living"
"We have to push a little to make the deadline!"
"She is driving away at her doctoral thesis"

means.word_mean: 5. press against forcefully without being able to move;

sentences.sentence: "she pushed against the wall with all her strength"

means.word_mean: 6. approach a certain age or speed;

sentences.sentence: "She is pushing fifty"

means.word_mean: 7. exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person; be an advocate for;

sentences.sentence: "The liberal party pushed for reforms"
"She is crusading for women's rights"
"The Dean is pushing for his favorite candidate"

means.word_mean: 8. sell or promote the sale of (illegal goods such as drugs);

sentences.sentence: "The guy hanging around the school is pushing drugs"

means.word_mean: 9. move strenuously and with effort;

sentences.sentence: "The crowd pushed forward"

means.word_mean: 10. make strenuous pushing movements during birth to expel the baby;

sentences.sentence: "`Now push hard,' said the doctor to the woman"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from Old French pousser, from Latin pulsare 'to push, beat, pulse' (see pulse). The early sense was 'exert force on', giving rise later to 'make a strenuous effort, endeavour'

means: People United to Save Humanity 人们团结去挽救人类
People United to Serve Humanity 人们团结服务人类

sentences.cn: 我们推了又推，但钢琴一动不动。
sentences.en: We pushed and pushed but the piano wouldn't move.

sentences.cn: 我叫你推时，你就使劲推。
sentences.en: Push hard when I tell you to.

sentences.cn: 她推了推门，但门纹丝不动。
sentences.en: She pushed at the door but it wouldn't budge.

sentences.cn: 你推，我拉。
sentences.en: You push and I'll pull.

sentences.cn: 他推着自行车缓缓爬上山。
sentences.en: He walked slowly up the hill pushing his bike.

sentences.cn: 她把杯子推向我这边。
sentences.en: She pushed the cup towards me.

sentences.cn: 他向后挪挪椅子，站了起来。
sentences.en: He pushed his chair back and stood up.

sentences.cn: 他想吻她，但她把他推开了。
sentences.en: He tried to kiss her but she pushed him away.

sentences.cn: 她把脸凑近了他。
sentences.en: She pushed her face towards him.

sentences.cn: 我推开了门。
